data.title: Sakyo Komatsu, First Edition
data.meta_description: Japan sinkt. Wissenschaftlich- phantastischer Roman. by Komatsu, Sakyo: and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Paperback. Condition: Very Good. First Edition. A copy that has been read, but is in excellent condition. Pages are intact and not marred by notes or highlighting. The spine remains undamaged.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. No Jacket. 1st Edition. FIRST PRINTING.MASSIVE BOOK.TEXT AND ESSAYS IN ENGLISH .BOOK WAS SOLD AT THE VARIOUS EXHIBITIONS AROUND JAPAN FROM MARCH 2000 THROUGH APRIL 2001. A NEAR FINE COPY WITH CD ROM AT BACK UNOPENED.SOME AMAZING PHOTOGRAPHS. a heavy book requiring extra postage for non uk address.34.Language: eng Language: eng 0.0 Language: eng 0.0 Language: eng 0.0 Language: eng 0.0 Language: eng Language: eng.

Hardcover first edition - First US printing. A novel which was both an enormous best seller in Japan and the basis for a very popular film. The Japanese archipelego is being wrenched by enormous forces - a parable for our times on how we deal with natural disasters, the consequences of global warming, national identity and the essential relocation of millions of people. Translated from the Japanese by Michael Gallagher. 184 pp. Very good in a good dust jacket (some sunning to the edges of the boards, rubbing and edgewear to the dj).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Translated from the Japanese by Michael Gallagher. First printing thus. Previous owner's name and date on front free endpaper, else very good in a very good (minor edge wear), price clipped dust jacket. ; 184 pages.
